trans-unit.source: Represents an individual item within a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> ASP.NET mobile control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Although the class name is MobileListItem, the element name is `Item`.
On a mobile page, you declare an item by using the [\<Item>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/7152e195-e1d6-4a91-9dba-e0536a676e79)element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the missing elements set to `null.` The default constructor initializes all properties to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the missing elements set to `null`.
The object is initialized with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property set to the value of the `text` parameter.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Type>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the missing elements set to `null`.
The object is initialized with the `itemType` parameter.
Initializes the specified item with this item type.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the missing elements set to `null`.

The object is initialized with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> properties set to the values of the corresponding `text` and `value` parameters.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*>.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value*>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the missing elements set to `null`.

The object is initialized with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.DataItem%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> properties set to the values of the corresponding `dataItem`, `text`, and `value` parameters.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.DataItem*>.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*>.
Initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value*>.
Gets or sets the data item to which the list item is bound.
This property is available only on a request where the list item is data-bound; on subsequent postbacks, it is always <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> is bound.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> instances are equal.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object to compare with the current item.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the items are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> property.
This method is used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The initial value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> with an initialized <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> property.
Returns the hash code for the current instance.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The hash code for the current instance.
Gets the index for an item within a list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The position of the item within the containing list.
Gets a value indicating whether the list item control is tracking changes to its view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list item is tracking changes to its view state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the current view state into the list item control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the item's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> and optional <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value*> property values.
Determines whether the event for the server control is passed up the page's user interface (UI) server control hierarchy.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The source object of the event.
The event arguments.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event is passed up the control hierarchy; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Saves the changes to the view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the newly saved view state.
Gets or sets whether the list item is selected in its parent <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is selected in its parent <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false." name="false." href=""></xref>
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> and the optional <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value*>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The view-state changes for the control.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Gets or sets the text contained in the item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If the Text property is an empty string or is never set, either programmatically or through the constructor, it returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property for the specified list item.
The Text property can be specified by using the `Text` attribute, or as inner text.
If the Text property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence.
However, if the Text property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
The text in the item.
The default is an empty string ("").
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string that represents the current item.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.IsTrackingViewState*> property to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets or sets the value contained in the list item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If this property is `null`, a call to retrieve the value returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property.
The value contained in the list item.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
